1.english: In that hour the disciples came to Jesus, saying, “Who then is greatest in the Kingdom of Heaven?”
1.wedau: I au raketana [hour]  tauvotaghotagho neꞌi da Yesu riwa ipa [“who] maratagogi  [greatest] au  vibadana ana [heaven?”]
1.translation_notes: Primary dimension: Power (0.89); Strong secondary: Justice

2.english: Jesus called a little child to himself, and set him in the middle of them,
2.wedau: Yesu ghorehi  [little] ghoraghora da [himself] ma [set] tauna au  [middle] ana hita

3.english: and said, “Most certainly I tell you, unless you turn, and become as little children, you will in no way enter into the Kingdom of Heaven.
3.wedau: ma riwa [“most] [certainly] tau riwehi omi [unless] omi [turn] ma [become]  [little] natunatuna omi ina au egha parata rui au  vibadana ana marei
3.translation_notes: Primary dimension: Justice (0.78); Strong secondary: Wisdom

4.english: Whoever therefore humbles himself as this little child is the greatest in the Kingdom of Heaven.
4.wedau: [whoever] [therefore] [humbles] [himself]  ina [little] ghoraghora   [greatest] au  vibadana ana marei
4.translation_notes: Primary dimension: Wisdom (0.83); Strong secondary: Justice

5.english: Whoever receives one such little child in my name receives me,

6.english: but whoever causes one of these little ones who believe in me to stumble, it would be better for him if a huge millstone were hung around his neck, and that he were sunk in the depths of the sea.
6.wedau: tuna [whoever] [causes] [one] ana ina [little] au aiyai tumaghanei au tau da [stumble] tauna ina  [better] yamna tauna tora  [huge] [millstone]  [hung] [around] ana [neck] ma raketana tauna  [sunk] au  [depths] ana  topana

7.english: “Woe to the world because of occasions of stumbling! For it must be that the occasions come, but woe to that person through whom the occasion comes!
7.wedau: [“woe] da  dobuna yamna ana [occasions] ana [stumbling!] yamna tauna ina  raketana  [occasions] neꞌi tuna [woe] da raketana [person] au aiyai  [occasion] [comes!]

8.english: If your hand or your foot causes you to stumble, cut it off, and cast it from you. It is better for you to enter into life maimed or crippled, rather than having two hands or two feet to be cast into the eternal fire.
8.wedau: tora ami nimana bo ami [foot] [causes] omi da [stumble] [cut] tauna [off] ma [cast] tauna au omi tauna  [better] yamna omi da rui au yawahana [maimed] bo [crippled] [rather] da [having] [two] nimana bo [two] [feet] da  [cast] au  [eternal] [fire]

9.english: If your eye causes you to stumble, pluck it out, and cast it from you. It is better for you to enter into life with one eye, rather than having two eyes to be cast into the Gehenna of fire.
9.wedau: tora ami [eye] [causes] omi da [stumble] [pluck] tauna hopu ma [cast] tauna au omi tauna  [better] yamna omi da rui au yawahana maitehi [one] [eye] [rather] da [having] [two] [eyes] da  [cast] au  [gehenna] ana [fire]

10.english: See that you don’t despise one of these little ones, for I tell you that in heaven their angels always see the face of my Father who is in heaven.
10.wedau: inana raketana omi [don’t] [despise] [one] ana ina [little] au yamna tau riwehi omi raketana au marei ahi aneya [always] inana  [face] ana au Tamatei aiyai  au marei

11.english: For the Son of Man came to save that which was lost.
11.wedau: yamna  natuna ana oroto neꞌi da [save] raketana aiyai  [lost]

12.english: “What do you think? If a man has one hundred sheep, and one of them goes astray, doesn’t he leave the ninety-nine, go to the mountains, and seek that which has gone astray?
12.wedau: [“what] rura omi [think?] tora  oroto ana [one] [hundred] [sheep] ma [one] ana hita nae [astray] [doesn’t] tauna [leave]  [ninety-nine] nae da  dobuna ma [seek] raketana aiyai ana nae [astray?]

13.english: If he finds it, most certainly I tell you, he rejoices over it more than over the ninety-nine which have not gone astray.
13.wedau: tora tauna [finds] tauna anatapuhi [certainly] tau riwehi omi tauna tumaghanei au tauna ghe vavahagha da au  [ninety-nine] aiyai ana egha nae [astray]

14.english: Even so it is not the will of your Father who is in heaven that one of these little ones should perish.
14.wedau: ma yamna tauna  egha  ina ana ami Tamatei aiyai  au marei raketana [one] ana ina [little] au ina [perish]

15.english: “If your brother sins against you, go, show him his fault between you and him alone. If he listens to you, you have gained back your brother.
15.wedau: [“if] ami tevera ghohaꞌapoapoe awarina omi nae atataiyana tauna ana [fault] au omi ma tauna [alone] tora tauna [listens] da omi omi ana [gained] [back] ami tevera
15.translation_notes: Primary dimension: Wisdom (0.50); Low harmony verse (distinctive emphasis)

16.english: But if he doesn’t listen, take one or two more with you, that at the mouth of two or three witnesses every word may be established.
16.wedau: tuna tora tauna [doesn’t] [listen] varahai [one] bo [two] ghe vavahagha maitehi omi raketana au  [mouth] ana [two] bo [three] [witnesses] anatapuhi riwana ita  [established]

17.english: If he refuses to listen to them, tell it to the assembly. If he refuses to hear the assembly also, let him be to you as a Gentile or a tax collector.
17.wedau: tora tauna [refuses] da [listen] da hita riwehi tauna da  [assembly] tora tauna [refuses] da [hear]  [assembly] maitehi ita tauna  da omi   [gentile] bo  [tax] [collector]

18.english: Most certainly I tell you, whatever things you bind on earth will have been bound in heaven, and whatever things you release on earth will have been released in heaven.
18.wedau: anatapuhi [certainly] tau riwehi omi [whatever] [things] omi [bind] au dobuna ina ana  [bound] au marei ma [whatever] [things] omi [release] au dobuna ina ana  [released] au marei

19.english: Again, assuredly I tell you, that if two of you will agree on earth concerning anything that they will ask, it will be done for them by my Father who is in heaven.
19.wedau: vouna [assuredly] tau riwehi omi raketana tora [two] ana omi ina [agree] au dobuna [concerning] [anything] raketana tauhi ina rau-baghei tauna ina  [done] yamna hita au au Tamatei aiyai  au marei

20.english: For where two or three are gathered together in my name, there I am in the middle of them.”
20.wedau: yamna aiwaꞌi [two] bo [three]  tagogiyehi [together] au au wava kampa tau [am] au  [middle] ana [them”]

21.english: Then Peter came and said to him, “Lord, how often shall my brother sin against me, and I forgive him? Until seven times?”
21.wedau: maratagogi [peter] neꞌi ma riwa da tauna [“lord] aiwaꞌi [often] ina au tevera [sin] awarina tau ma tau [forgive] [him?] [until] [seven] [times?”]
21.translation_notes: Primary dimension: Wisdom (0.75); Strong secondary: Love

22.english: Jesus said to him, “I don’t tell you until seven times, but, until seventy times seven.
22.wedau: Yesu riwa da tauna [“i] [don’t] riwehi omi [until] [seven] mara tuna [until] [seventy] mara [seven]

23.english: Therefore the Kingdom of Heaven is like a certain king, who wanted to reconcile accounts with his servants.
23.wedau: [therefore]  vibadana ana marei  [like]  [certain] kingi aiyai [wanted] da [reconcile] [accounts] maitehi ana taunoya
23.translation_notes: Primary dimension: Justice (0.80); Strong secondary: Wisdom

24.english: When he had begun to reconcile, one was brought to him who owed him ten thousand talents.
24.wedau: maranaina tauna ana [begun] da [reconcile] [one]  neiyahi da tauna aiyai [owed] tauna [ten] [thousand] [talents]

25.english: But because he couldn’t pay, his lord commanded him to be sold, with his wife, his children, and all that he had, and payment to be made.
25.wedau: tuna yamna tauna [couldn’t] [pay] ana Guyau ririweiya tauna da  [sold] maitehi ana [wife] ana natunatuna ma anatapuhi raketana tauna ana ma [payment] da  rura

26.english: The servant therefore fell down and knelt before him, saying, ‘Lord, have patience with me, and I will repay you all!’
26.wedau: [servant] [therefore] [fell] au ma [knelt] naona tauna riwa ipa [‘lord] ana [patience] maitehi tau ma tau ina [repay] omi [all!’]

27.english: The lord of that servant, being moved with compassion, released him, and forgave him the debt.
27.wedau: Guyau ana raketana [servant]  nuwaboyei maitehi [compassion] [released] tauna ma [forgave] tauna  [debt]
27.translation_notes: Primary dimension: Wisdom (0.73); Strong secondary: Love

28.english: “But that servant went out, and found one of his fellow servants, who owed him one hundred denarii, and he grabbed him, and took him by the throat, saying, ‘Pay me what you owe!’
28.wedau: [“but] raketana [servant] nae hopu ma tuhaghai [one] ana ana [fellow] taunoya aiyai [owed] tauna [one] [hundred] [denarii] ma tauna [grabbed] tauna ma varahai tauna au  [throat] riwa ipa [‘pay] tau aiwaꞌi omi [owe!’]

29.english: “So his fellow servant fell down at his feet and begged him, saying, ‘Have patience with me, and I will repay you!’
29.wedau: [“so] ana [fellow] [servant] [fell] au au ana [feet] ma [begged] tauna riwa ipa [‘have] [patience] maitehi tau ma tau ina [repay] [you!’]

30.english: He would not, but went and cast him into prison, until he should pay back that which was due.
30.wedau: tauna ina egha tuna nae ma [cast] tauna au deri [until] tauna ina [pay] [back] raketana aiyai  [due]

31.english: So when his fellow servants saw what was done, they were exceedingly sorry, and came and told their lord all that was done.
31.wedau: yamna maranaina ana [fellow] taunoya inana aiwaꞌi  [done] tauhi  [exceedingly] [sorry] ma neꞌi ma riwehi ahi Guyau anatapuhi raketana  [done]

32.english: Then his lord called him in, and said to him, ‘You wicked servant! I forgave you all that debt, because you begged me.
32.wedau: maratagogi ana Guyau ghorehi tauna au ma riwa da tauna [‘you] [wicked] [servant!] tau [forgave] omi anatapuhi raketana [debt] yamna omi [begged] tau

33.english: Shouldn’t you also have had mercy on your fellow servant, even as I had mercy on you?’
33.wedau: [shouldn’t] omi maitehi ana ana nuwaboyei au ami [fellow] [servant] ma  tau ana nuwaboyei au [you?’]

34.english: His lord was angry, and delivered him to the tormentors, until he should pay all that was due to him.
34.wedau: ana Guyau  [angry] ma [delivered] tauna da  [tormentors] [until] tauna ina [pay] anatapuhi raketana  [due] da tauna

35.english: So my heavenly Father will also do to you, if you don’t each forgive your brother from your hearts for his misdeeds.”
35.wedau: yamna au marei Tamatei ina maitehi rura da omi tora omi [don’t] tagotagogi [forgive] ami tevera au ami urana yamna ana [misdeeds”]
